item.title: Resident parking spaces filled with commercial vehicles, 10th September
item.description:
In the past month the 4 of the six spaces used by residents have been filled with commercial vehicles parked permanently and do not move. this is forcing Charmouth Road residents to park in Tavistock road forcing Tavistock residents away from their properties. I believe all the vehicles belong to one firm and after some basic checks a white Citroën van has no MOT unsure if ther is anything that can be done
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charmouth Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Private hedge overhanging half the pavement width opposite school., 10th September
item.description:
Very tall and bushy conifer(?) trees on private property at no.241 Days Lane which overhang half the width of the pavement. Low hanging branches scratch adults' legs and/or faces of children in buggies. Insufficient room for 2 buggies to pass one another on the pavement, so that one buggy has to be pushed into the road. With school parking, this is equally as unsafe. Can owners please be requested to trim their conifer hedge, please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 243, Days Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food Delivery Bike at Speed on footpath, 10th September
item.description:
Uber / Deliveroo electric bike whizzed by group of walkers today adjacent to picnic area at excessive speed. Speed humps / chicanes required to slow bikes down. Bike would not have been able to stop if someone came off paths by picnic area onto tarmac path. Speeding bikes are becoming more of a nuisance in this pleasant Country Park. How long before someone is hit and badly injured or worse?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merton Gardens, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking, 10th September
item.description:
You take your life in your hands trying to get out of this junction, you can’t see anything coming on the right and barely any traffic on the left. If someone parks on the other side traffic builds up. There seems to be a lot of parking in recent weeks and right up to the junction of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21-40, Cavell Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Existing Markings disappeared, 10th September
item.description:
4 parking bays and crossed yellow hatching outside entrance to Tent Peg Lane / Jubilee Park Car Park have almost worn away. New markings required to stop commuters partly blocking entrance to car park by parking on area where yellow box should be.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tent Peg Lane, Petts Wood, London
